TypeSignature.Value: .class public sequential ansi sealed beforefieldinit HwndSourceParameters extends System.ValueType

Docs.summary: Contains the parameters that are used to create an object using the constructor.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This structure is used only in the <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSource> object constructor call.
The properties whose values are established by this structure are not directly exposed on <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSource> instances when an <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSource> is constructed. However, the values of the <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters> structure typically affect general [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_ui](~/includes/tla2sharptla-ui-md.md)] properties such as "Height" and "Width" that might exist in specific hosted objects and their [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_api#plural](~/includes/tla2sharptla-apisharpplural-md.md)].
> [!IMPORTANT] > Do not construct instances of this structure using the default (parameterless) constructor. An <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters> instance that is created by the default constructor results in <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters> that cannot be assigned a <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters.WindowName%2A> (even though the <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters.WindowName%2A> property appears to be settable). If such an instance is applied as the parameters for an <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSource> constructor, the resulting <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSource>cannot display a window.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. Do not use the default constructor for ; see Remarks.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!IMPORTANT] > Do not construct instances of this structure using the default (parameterless) constructor. An <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters> instance that is created by the default constructor results in <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters> that cannot be assigned a <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters.WindowName%2A> (even though the <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters.WindowName%2A> property appears to be settable). If such an instance is applied as the parameters for an <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSource> constructor, the resulting <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSource> cannot display a window.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string name) cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified window name.

MemberSignature.Value: public HwndSourceParameters (string name, int width, int height);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string name, int32 width, int32 height) cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified window name and initial size.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Do not pass 0 (zero) for either the `width` or `height` parameters. Although the method eventually succeeds, even if you do pass 0, a significant performance penalty occurs.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the value that determines whether to acquire Win32 focus for the WPF containing window when an is created.
Docs.value: to acquire Win32 focus for the WPF containing window when the user interacts with menus; otherwise, . to use the value of .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to include the nonclient area for sizing.
Docs.value: if the layout manager sizing logic should include the nonclient area; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Window> class sets this parameter to `true` when using this structure internally, as part of its [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_win32](~/includes/tlasharptla-win32-md.md)] window-creation process.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance bool Equals(object obj) cil managed

Docs.param: The objects to be tested for equality.
Docs.summary: Determines whether this structure is equal to a specified object.
Docs.returns: if the comparison is equal; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This implementation checks all members (public and private) of both structures for exact value equality.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool Equals(valuetype System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters obj) cil managed

Docs.param: The structure to be tested for equality.
Docs.summary: Determines whether this structure is equal to a specified structure.
Docs.returns: if the structures are equal; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This implementation checks all members (public and private) of both structures for exact value equality.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the extended [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_win](~/includes/tlasharptla-win-md.md)] styles for the window.
Docs.value: The extended window styles. See [CreateWindowEx](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=98462) for a list of these styles. The default is 0 (no extended window styles).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance int32 GetHashCode() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the hash code for this instance.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This implementation uses the Object implementation of GetHashCode.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether a size was assigned.
Docs.value: if the window size was assigned; otherwise, . The default is , unless the structure was created with provided height and width, in which case the value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks If a size was not assigned, the window has the default size.
Calls to <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters.SetSize%2A> or setting <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters.Width%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters.Height%2A> all result in this property being `true`.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates the height of the window.
Docs.value: The height of the window, in device pixels. The default value is 1.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Unlike most methods that take rectangle screen-region measures in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)], you specify this window size in device pixels, not the typical device-independent units. If you need to size your window to its content, set <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSource.SizeToContent%2A> to `true`.
Do not set <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters.Height%2A> to 0 (zero). Doing so incurs a significant performance penalty in rendering.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the message hook for the window.
Docs.value: The message hook for the window.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This message hook is enabled before `CreateWindow` is called so that it receives all the window creation messages.

.method public static hidebysig specialname bool op_Equality(valuetype System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters a, valuetype System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters b) cil managed

Docs.returns: if the structures are equal; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This implementation calls the <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters.Equals%2A> method.

Docs.returns: if the structures are not equal; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This implementation calls the <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters.Equals%2A> method and inverts the result.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the window handle (HWND) of the parent for the created window.
Docs.value: The HWND of the parent window.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the left-edge position of the window.
Docs.value: The left-edge position of the window. The default is CW_USEDEFAULT, as processed by CreateWindow.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the upper-edge position of the window.
Docs.value: The upper-edge position of the window. The default is CW_USEDEFAULT, as processed by CreateWindow.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets how WPF handles restoring focus to the window.
Docs.value: One of the enumeration values that specifies how WPF handles restoring focus for the window. The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks WPF automatically tries to restore focus to the window unless <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters.RestoreFocusMode%2A> is set to <xref:System.Windows.Input.RestoreFocusMode.None>.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetPosition (int x, int y);
.method public hidebysig instance void SetPosition(int32 x, int32 y) cil managed

Docs.param: The position of the left edge of the window.
The position of the upper edge of the window.
Docs.summary: Sets the values that are used for the screen position of the window for the .

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetSize (int width, int height);
.method public hidebysig instance void SetSize(int32 width, int32 height) cil managed

Docs.param: The width of the window, in device pixels.
The height of the window, in device pixels.
Docs.summary: Sets the values that are used for the window size of the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Unlike most methods that take rectangle screen-region measures in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)], you specify this window size in device pixels, not in the typical device-independent units. If you need to size your window to its content, set <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSource.SizeToContent%2A> to `true`.
Do not pass 0 (zero) for either the `width` or `height` parameters. Although the method eventually succeeds even if you do pass 0, a substantial performance penalty occurs.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the parent windows of the should be considered the non-client area of the window during layout passes.
Docs.value: if parent windows of the should be considered the non-client area of the window during layout passes.; otherwise, . The default is .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the should receive window messages raised by the message pump via the .
Docs.value: if the should receive window messages raised by the message pump via the ; otherwise, . The default is if the corresponds to a top-level window; otherwise, the default is .

Docs.summary: Gets a value that declares whether the per-pixel opacity of the source window content is respected.

remarks.format:
## Remarks By enabling per-pixel opacity, the system no longer draws the non-client area.
The opacity is used when the window is drawn on the desktop (it represents a final rendering step and does not appear as a contributor to property values such as <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.Opacity%2A>).
<xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters.UsesPerPixelOpacity%2A> applies only to top-level windows.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that declares whether the per-pixel transparency of the source window content is respected.
Gets or sets a value that indicates the width of the window.
Docs.value: The window width, in device pixels. The default value is 1.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Unlike most methods that take rectangle screen region measures in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)], you specify this window's size in device pixels, not in the usual device-independent units. If you need to size your window to its content, set <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSource.SizeToContent%2A> to `true`.
Do not set <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters.Width%2A> to 0 (zero). Doing so incurs a substantial performance penalty in rendering.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_win](~/includes/tlasharptla-win-md.md)] class style for the window.
Docs.value: The window class style. See [Window Class Styles](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=178417) for detailed information. The default is 0 (no window class style).

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the window.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!IMPORTANT] > Do not construct instances of this structure using the default (parameterless) constructor. An <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters> instance that is created by the default constructor results in <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters> that cannot be assigned a <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters.WindowName%2A> (even though the <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters.WindowName%2A> property appears to be settable). If such an instance is applied as the parameters for an <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSource> constructor, the resulting <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSource> cannot display a window.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the style for the window.
Docs.value: The window style. See the [CreateWindowEx](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=98462) function for a complete list of style bits. Defaults: WS_VISIBLE, WS_CAPTION, WS_SYSMENU, WS_THICKFRAME, WS_MINIMIZEBOX, WS_MAXIMIZEBOX, WS_CLIPCHILDREN

remarks.format:
## Remarks By default, the following bits are set when the structure is created: WS_VISIBLE; WS_CAPTION; WS_SYSMENU; WS_THICKFRAME; WS_MINIMIZEBOX; WS_MAXIMIZEBOX; WS_CLIPCHILDREN.
For a standard window, you must set the WS_CLIPCHILDREN bit. This style bit is enforced in the code itself; if you omit to set this flag, WPF adds it to whatever value you provide.
